traits.name: Berserk
entries: If the core inside the colossus is destroyed, the colossus goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the colossus attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the colossus attacks an object. Once the colossus goes berserk, it remains berserk until it is destroyed.

traits.name: Immutable Form
entries: The colossus is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The colossus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Siege Monster
entries: The colossus deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
entries: The colossus makes two Fist attacks.

actions.name: Fist
entries: Melee atk +13 to hit (with advantage if the colossus is berserk), reach 20 ft., one target. 17 (3d6 + 7 damage) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is pulled up to 15 feet toward the colossus, it has the {@condition grappled} condition (escape DC 17), and it has the {@condition restrained} condition until this grapple ends. The colossus can have up to two creatures {@condition grappled} this way at a time.

actions.name: Elemental Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The colossus exhales a cloud swirling with elemental energy in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 40 (9d8 damage) damage of a type of the colossus's choosing: acid, cold, fire, or lightning. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.
At the same time as the colossus releases this exhalation, creatures inside the colossus's chest cavity take 40 ({@damage 9d8}) force damage from churning elemental energy.
